name: Scarlet Kleinia
description: Kleinia grantii (synonym: Senecio coccineiflorus), commonly known as Scarlet Kleinia, is a succulent native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly East Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and features upright, fleshy, green stems (30-60 cm tall) with small, fleshy, green leaves. The plant produces small, scarlet to red, daisy-like flowers in clusters. The plant displays an upright, bushy growth habit and typically reaches 30-60 cm in height. In its native habitat, it grows in well-draining, rocky soils in semi-arid to tropical regions. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds natural beauty with its succulent form and colorful flowers. It's popular among succulent enthusiasts for its attractive blooms.
